subject: Re: [junit] Re: Any plans to revamp junit?
msgSnippet: ... I don t include Junit in that; and I don t you if you do. ... By dead I mean not actively developed. It is reasonable to me to call an inactive open source
messageBody:
Ilja Preuss wrote:

> Some things are just mature enough that there is no need for more
> releases.

I don't include Junit in that; and I don't you if you do.


> With such a big user base - hell, actually being the pseudo
> standard for unit testing in Java - I find it strange to think of it as
> "dead".

By dead I mean not actively developed. It is reasonable to me to
call an inactive open source project dead irrespective of how many
users it has.

cheers
Bill
